dir=\"auto\"\u003eFormatters are meant to be an additional layer of processing of the transcript you pass it. The goal is to convert the transcript from its Python data type into a consistent string of a given \"format\". Such as a basic text (\u003ccode\u003e.txt\u003c/code\u003e) or even formats that have a defined specification such as JSON (\u003ccode\u003e.json\u003c/code\u003e), WebVTT (\u003ccode\u003e.vtt\u003c/code\u003e), SRT (\u003ccode\u003e.srt\u003c/code\u003e), Comma-separated format (\u003ccode\u003e.csv\u003c/code\u003e), etc...\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eformatters\u003c/code\u003e submodule provides a few basic formatters to wrap around you transcript data in cases where you might want to do something such as output a specific format then write that format to a file. Maybe to backup/store and run another script against at a later time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWe provided a few subclasses of formatters to use:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eJSONFormatter\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePrettyPrintFormatter\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTextFormatter\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWebVTTFormatter\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSRTFormatter\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eHere is how to import from the \u003ccode\u003eformatters\u003c/code\u003e module.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative format as the API returned it as. That would look something like this:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"# your_custom_script.py\n\nfrom youtube_transcript_api import YouTubeTranscriptApi\nfrom youtube_transcript_api.formatters import JSONFormatter\n\n# Must be a single transcript.\ntranscript = YouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcript(video_id)\n\nformatter = JSONFormatter()\n\n# .format_transcript(transcript) turns the transcript into a JSON string.\njson_formatted = formatter.format_transcript(transcript)\n\n\n# Now we can write it out to a file.\nwith open('your_filename.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as json_file:\n    json_file.write(json_formatted)\n\n# Now should have a new JSON file that you can easily read back into Python.\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-v\"\u003eYouTubeTranscriptApi\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eget_transcript\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003evideo_id\u003c/span\u003e)\n\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eformatter\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan alt="image" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/pypi/pyversions/youtube-transcript-api.svg" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto">This is a python API which allows you to get the transcript/subtitles for a given YouTube video. It also works for automatically generated subtitles, supports translating subtitles and it does not require a headless browser, like other selenium based solutions do!</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Install</h2><a id="user-content-install" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Install" href="#install"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">It is recommended to <a href="https://pypi.org/project/youtube-transcript-api/" rel="nofollow">install this module by using pip</a>:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pip install youtube-transcript-api"><pre class="notranslate"><code>pip install youtube-transcript-api</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">If you want to use it from source, you'll have to install the dependencies manually:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pip install -r requirements.txt"><pre class="notranslate"><code>pip install -r requirements.txt</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">You can either integrate this module <a href="#api">into an existing application</a>, or just use it via an <a href="#cli">CLI</a>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">API</h2><a id="user-content-api" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: API" href="#api"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The easiest way to get a transcript for a given video is to execute:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from youtube_transcript_api import YouTubeTranscriptApiYouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcript(video_id)"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">youtube_transcript_api</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span><span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_transcript</span>(<span class="pl-s1">video_id</span>)</pre></div><blockquote><p dir="auto"><strong>Note:</strong> By default, this will try to access the English transcript of the video. If your video has a different language, or you are interested in fetching a different language's transcript, please read the section below.</p></blockquote><p dir="auto">This will return a list of dictionaries looking somewhat like this:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="[    {        'text': 'Hey there',        'start': 7.58,        'duration': 6.13    },    {        'text': 'how are you',        'start': 14.08,        'duration': 7.58    },    # ...]"><pre>[    {        <span class="pl-s">'text'</span>: <span class="pl-s">'Hey there'</span>,        <span class="pl-s">'start'</span>: <span class="pl-c1">7.58</span>,        <span class="pl-s">'duration'</span>: <span class="pl-c1">6.13</span>    },    {        <span class="pl-s">'text'</span>: <span class="pl-s">'how are you'</span>,        <span class="pl-s">'start'</span>: <span class="pl-c1">14.08</span>,        <span class="pl-s">'duration'</span>: <span class="pl-c1">7.58</span>    },    <span class="pl-c"># ...</span>]</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Retrieve different languages</h3><a id="user-content-retrieve-different-languages" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Retrieve different languages" href="#retrieve-different-languages"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">You can add the <code>languages</code> param if you want to make sure the transcripts are retrieved in your desired language (it defaults to english).</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="YouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcript(video_id, languages=['de', 'en'])"><pre><span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_transcript</span>(<span class="pl-s1">video_id</span>, <span class="pl-s1">languages</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span>[<span class="pl-s">'de'</span>, <span class="pl-s">'en'</span>])</pre></div><p dir="auto">It's a list of language codes in a descending priority. In this example it will first try to fetch the german transcript (<code>'de'</code>) and then fetch the english transcript (<code>'en'</code>) if it fails to do so. If you want to find out which languages are available first, <a href="#list-available-transcripts">have a look at <code>list_transcripts()</code></a>.</p><p dir="auto">If you only want one language, you still need to format the <code>languages</code> argument as a list</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="YouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcript(video_id, languages=['de'])"><pre><span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_transcript</span>(<span class="pl-s1">video_id</span>, <span class="pl-s1">languages</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span>[<span class="pl-s">'de'</span>])</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Batch fetching of transcripts</h3><a id="user-content-batch-fetching-of-transcripts" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Batch fetching of transcripts" href="#batch-fetching-of-transcripts"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">To get transcripts for a list of video ids you can call:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="YouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcripts(["video_id1", "video_id2"], languages=['de', 'en'])"><pre><span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_transcripts</span>([<span class="pl-s">"video_id1"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"video_id2"</span>], <span class="pl-s1">languages</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span>[<span class="pl-s">'de'</span>, <span class="pl-s">'en'</span>])</pre></div><p dir="auto"><code>languages</code> also is optional here.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Preserve formatting</h3><a id="user-content-preserve-formatting" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Preserve formatting" href="#preserve-formatting"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">You can also add <code>preserve_formatting=True</code> if you'd like to keep HTML formatting elements such as <code><i></code> (italics) and <code><b></code> (bold).</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="YouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcripts(video_ids, languages=['de', 'en'], preserve_formatting=True)"><pre><span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>.<span class="pl-s">'en'</span>], <span class="pl-s1">preserve_formatting</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">True</span>)</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 video you can call:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="transcript_list = YouTubeTranscriptApi.list_transcripts(video_id)"><pre><span class="pl-s1">transcript_list</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>.<span class="pl-en">list_transcripts</span>(<span class="pl-s1">video_id</span>)</pre></div><p dir="auto">This will return a <code>TranscriptList</code> object  which is iterable and provides methods to filter the list of transcripts for specific languages and types, like:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="transcript = transcript_list.find_transcript(['de', 'en'])"><pre><span class="pl-s1">transcript</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">transcript_list</span>.<span class="pl-en">find_transcript</span>([<span class="pl-s">'de'</span>, <span class="pl-s">'en'</span>])</pre></div><p dir="auto">By default this module always picks manually created transcripts over automatically created ones, if a transcript in the requested language is available both manually created and generated. The <code>TranscriptList</code> allows you to bypass this default behaviour by searching for specific transcript types:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="# filter for manually created transcriptstranscript = transcript_list.find_manually_created_transcript(['de', 'en'])# or automatically generated onestranscript = transcript_list.find_generated_transcript(['de', 'en'])"><pre><span class="pl-c"># filter for manually created transcripts</span><span class="pl-s1">transcript</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">transcript_list</span>.<span class="pl-en">find_manually_created_transcript</span>([<span class="pl-s">'de'</span>, <span class="pl-s">'en'</span>])<span class="pl-c"># or automatically generated ones</span><span class="pl-s1">transcript</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">transcript_list</span>.<span class="pl-en">find_generated_transcript</span>([<span class="pl-s">'de'</span>, <span class="pl-s">'en'</span>])</pre></div><p dir="auto">The methods <code>find_generated_transcript</code>, <code>find_manually_created_transcript</code>, <code>find_transcript</code> return <code>Transcript</code> objects. They contain metadata regarding the transcript:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="print(    transcript.video_id,    transcript.language,    transcript.language_code,    # whether it has been manually created or generated by YouTube    transcript.is_generated,    # whether this transcript can be translated or not    transcript.is_translatable,    # a list of languages the transcript can be translated to    transcript.translation_languages,)"><pre><span class="pl-en">print</span>(    <span class="pl-s1">transcript</span>.<span class="pl-s1">video_id</span>,    <span class="pl-s1">transcript</span>.<span class="pl-s1">language</span>,    <span class="pl-s1">transcript</span>.<span class="pl-s1">language_code</span>,    <span class="pl-c"># whether it has been manually created or generated by YouTube</span>    <span class="pl-s1">transcript</span>.<span   <span class="pl-c"># a list of languages the transcript can be translated to</span>    <span class="pl-s1">transcript</span>.<span class="pl-s1">translation_languages</span>,)</pre></div><p 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Formatters are meant to be an additional layer of processing of the transcript you pass it. The goal is to convert the transcript from its Python data type into a consistent string of a given "format". Such as a basic text (<code>.txt</code>) or even formats that have a defined specification such as JSON (<code>.json</code>), WebVTT (<code>.vtt</code>), SRT (<code>.srt</code>), Comma-separated format (<code>.csv</code>), etc...</p><p dir="auto">The <code>formatters</code> submodule provides a few basic formatters to wrap around you transcript data in cases where you might want to do something such as output a specific format then write that format to a file. Maybe to backup/store and run another script against at a later time.</p><p dir="auto">We provided a few subclasses of formatters to use:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>JSONFormatter</li><li>PrettyPrintFormatter</li><li>TextFormatter</li><li>WebVTTFormatter</li><li>SRTFormatter</li></ul><p dir="auto">Here is how to import from the <code>formatters</code> module.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="# the base class to inherit from when creating your own formatter.from youtube_transcript_api.formatters import Formatter# some provided subclasses, each outputs a different string format.from youtube_transcript_api.formatters import JSONFormatterfrom youtube_transcript_api.formatters import TextFormatterfrom youtube_transcript_api.formatters import WebVTTFormatterfrom youtube_transcript_api.formatters import SRTFormatter"><pre><span class="pl-c"># the base class to inherit from when creating your own formatter.</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">youtube_transcript_api</span>.<span class="pl-s1">formatters</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">Formatter</span><span class="pl-c"># some provided subclasses, each outputs a different string format.</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">youtube_transcript_api</span>.<span class="pl-s1">formatters</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">JSONFormatter</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">youtube_transcript_api</span>.<span class="pl-s1">formatters</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">TextFormatter</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">youtube_transcript_api</span>.<span class="pl-s1">formatters</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">WebVTTFormatter</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">youtube_transcript_api</span>.<span class="pl-s1">formatters</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">SRTFormatter</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Provided Formatter Example</h3><a 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Lets say we wanted to retrieve a transcript and write that transcript as a JSON file in the same format as the API returned it as. That would look something like this:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="# your_custom_script.pyfrom youtube_transcript_api import YouTubeTranscriptApifrom youtube_transcript_api.formatters import JSONFormatter# Must be a single transcript.transcript = YouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcript(video_id)formatter = JSONFormatter()# .format_transcript(transcript) turns the transcript into a JSON string.json_formatted = formatter.format_transcript(transcript)# Now we can write it out to a file.with open('your_filename.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as json_file:    json_file.write(json_formatted)# Now should have a new JSON file that you can easily read back into Python."><pre><span class="pl-c"># your_custom_script.py</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">youtube_transcript_api</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">youtube_transcript_api</span>.<span class="pl-s1">formatters</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">JSONFormatter</span><span class="pl-c"># Must be a single transcript.</span><span class="pl-s1">transcript</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_transcript</span>(<span class="pl-s1">video_id</span>)<span class="pl-s1">formatter</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">JSONFormatter</span>()<span class="pl-c"># .format_transcript(transcript) turns the transcript into a JSON string.</span><span class="pl-s1">json_formatted</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">formatter</span>.<span class="pl-en">format_transcript</span>(<span class="pl-s1">transcript</span>)<span class="pl-c"># Now we can write it out to a file.</span><span class="pl-k">with</span> <span class="pl-en">open</span>(<span class="pl-s">'your_filename.json'</span>, <span class="pl-s">'w'</span>, <span class="pl-s1">encoding</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">'utf-8'</span>) <span class="pl-k">as</span> <span class="pl-s1">json_file</span>:    <span class="pl-s1">json_file</span>.<span class="pl-en">write</span>(<span class="pl-s1">json_formatted</span>)<span class="pl-c"># Now should have a new JSON file that you can easily read back into Python.</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>Passing extra keyword arguments</strong></p><p dir="auto">Since JSONFormatter leverages <code>json.dumps()</code> you can also forward keyword arguments into <code>.format_transcript(transcript)</code> such as making your file output prettier by forwarding the <code>indent=2</code> keyword argument.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="json_formatted = JSONFormatter().format_transcript(transcript, indent=2)"><pre><span class="pl-s1">json_formatted</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">JSONFormatter</span>().<span class="pl-en">format_transcript</span>(<span class="pl-s1">transcript</span>, <span class="pl-s1">indent</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>)</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Custom Just inherit from the <code>Formatter</code> base class and ensure you implement the <code>format_transcript(self, transcript, **kwargs)</code> and <code>format_transcripts(self, transcripts, **kwargs)</code> methods which should ultimately return a string when called on your formatter instance.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="class MyCustomFormatter(Formatter):    def format_transcript(self, transcript, **kwargs):        # Do your custom work in here, but return a string. class="pl-s1">kwargs</span>):        <span class="pl-c"># Do your custom work in here, but return a string.</span>        <span class="pl-k">return</span> <span class="pl-s">'your processed output data as a string.'</span>    <span class="pl-k">def</span> <span class="pl-en">format_transcripts</span>(<span class="pl-s1">self</span>, <span class="pl-s1">transcripts</span>, <span class="pl-c1">**</span><span class="pl-s1">kwargs</span>):        <span class="pl-c"># Do your custom work in here to format a list of transcripts, but return a string.</span>        <span class="pl-k">return</span> <span class="pl-s">'your processed output data as a string.'</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">CLI</h2><a id="user-content-cli" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: CLI" href="#cli"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Execute the CLI script using the video ids as parameters and the results will be printed out to the command line:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ...  "><pre class="notranslate"><code>youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ...  </code></pre></div><p dir="auto">The CLI also gives you the option to provide a list of preferred languages:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ... --languages de en  "><pre class="notranslate"><code>youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ... --languages de en  </code></pre></div><p dir="auto">You can also specify if you want to exclude automatically generated or manually created subtitles:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ... --languages de en --exclude-generatedyoutube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ... --languages de en --exclude-manually-created"><pre class="notranslate"><code>youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ... --languages de en --exclude-generatedyoutube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ... --languages de en --exclude-manually-created</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">If you would prefer to write it into a file or pipe it into another application, you can also output the results as json using the following line:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ... --languages de en --format json > transcripts.json"><pre class="notranslate"><code>youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ... --languages de en --format json > transcripts.json</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Translating transcripts using the CLI is also possible:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ... --languages en --translate de"><pre class="notranslate"><code>youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> ... --languages en --translate de</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">If you are not sure which languages are available for a given video you can call, to list all available transcripts:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="youtube_transcript_api --list-transcripts <first_video_id>"><pre class="notranslate"><code>youtube_transcript_api --list-transcripts <first_video_id></code></pre></div><p dir="auto">If a video's ID starts with a hyphen you'll have to mask the hyphen using <code>\</code> to prevent the CLI from mistaking it for a argument name. For example to get the transcript for the video with the ID <code>-abc123</code> run:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="youtube_transcript_api "\-abc123""><pre class="notranslate"><code>youtube_transcript_api "\-abc123"</code></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Proxy</h2><a id="user-content-proxy" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Proxy" href="#proxy"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">You can specify a https proxy, which will be used during the requests to YouTube:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from youtube_transcript_api import YouTubeTranscriptApi  YouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcript(video_id, proxies={"https": "https://user:pass@domain:port"})"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">youtube_transcript_api</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>  <span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_transcript</span>(<span class="pl-s1">video_id</span>, <span class="pl-s1">proxies</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span>{<span class="pl-s">"https"</span>: <span class="pl-s">"https://user:pass@domain:port"</span>})</pre></div><p dir="auto">As the <code>proxies</code> dict is passed on to the <code>requests.get(...)</code> call, it follows the <a href="https://requests.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user/advanced/#proxies" rel="nofollow">format used by the requests library</a>.</p><p dir="auto">Using the CLI:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> --https-proxy https://user:pass@domain:port"><pre class="notranslate"><code>youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> --https-proxy https://user:pass@domain:port</code></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Cookies</h2><a id="user-content-cookies" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Cookies" href="#cookies"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Some videos are age restricted, so this module won't be able to access those videos without some sort of authentication. To do this, you will need to have access to the desired video in a browser. Then, you will need to download that pages cookies into a text file. You can use the Chrome extension <a href="https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/cookiestxt/njabckikapfpffapmjgojcnbfjonfjfg?hl=en" rel="nofollow">cookies.txt</a> or the Firefox extension <a href="https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/cookies-txt/" rel="nofollow">cookies.txt</a>.</p><p dir="auto">Once you have that, you can use it with the module to access age-restricted videos' captions like so.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from youtube_transcript_api import YouTubeTranscriptApi  YouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcript(video_id, cookies='/path/to/your/cookies.txt')YouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcripts([video_id], cookies='/path/to/your/cookies.txt')"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">youtube_transcript_api</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>  <span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_transcript</span>(<span class="pl-s1">video_id</span>, <span class="pl-s1">cookies</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">'/path/to/your/cookies.txt'</span>)<span class="pl-v">YouTubeTranscriptApi</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_transcripts</span>([<span class="pl-s1">video_id</span>], <span class="pl-s1">cookies</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">'/path/to/your/cookies.txt'</span>)</pre></div><p dir="auto">Using the CLI:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> --cookies /path/to/your/cookies.txt"><pre class="notranslate"><code>youtube_transcript_api <first_video_id> <second_video_id> --cookies /path/to/your/cookies.txt</code></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Warning</h2><a uses an undocumented part of the YouTube API, which is called by the YouTube web-client. So there is no guarantee that it won't stop working tomorrow, if they change how things work. I will however do my best to make things working again as soon as possible if that happens.     This is a python API which allows you to get the transcript/subtitles for a given YouTube video.
